definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: Yet much of this forest is doomed.
sentences.chinese: 然而這片森林大多在劫難逃。

sentences.english: The big guy in the bright red mohawk was right.
sentences.chinese: 留大紅莫西幹頭的球迷是對的，火箭在劫難逃。

sentences.english: Heart's distance is really amatory inexorable doom .
sentences.chinese: 心的距離纔是愛情的劫難。

sentences.english: Externally, Flannery O’Connor’s life was, except in the matter of her physical travails, uneventful.
sentences.chinese: 其實，弗蘭納裏，除了病中劫難，她的生活波瀾不驚。

sentences.english: Did animals' " sixth sense" save them from tsunami?
sentences.chinese: 動物逃過海嘯大劫難全靠神祕“第六感”？

sentences.english: Does this mean doom for The Hobbit films?
sentences.chinese: 這是否意味着電影《霍比特人》在劫難逃？

sentences.english: In fact, nothing, no matter how remotely eatable, had escaped them.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，再不能喫的東西也在劫難逃。

sentences.english: Of young men die many, of old men escape not any.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人死得不少，而年邁者是在劫難逃。

sentences.english: At first, the theory seemed doomed.
sentences.chinese: 最開始，這個理論似乎在劫難逃。

sentences.english: It was a big deal in my life and it's in my past.
sentences.chinese: 這是我生命中的一個劫難，但它只存在於我的過去。

sentences.english: Much of that will depend on how much longer the leak continues.
sentences.chinese: 這場劫難到底多大禍害，就看這油漏到什麼時候了。

sentences.english: This is the greatest humiliation for the Buddhism and the greatest malignancy intolerable to Buddha Dharma.
sentences.chinese: 這是佛教亙古未有的大恥辱，佛法萬劫難容的大邪惡。

sentences.english: This unconditioned Dharma is difficult to encounter even once in a million eons, so don't overlook what's right before your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 這種無爲法，是百千萬劫難遭遇的，不可當面錯過。

definition: different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
